content:
ICS 1C HW 3 for Tom Terrones! =)

Things about Tom Terrones

Name:Tom Terrones
E-mail: eauu235@ea.oac.uci.edu
Major: Technically Unaffiliated, but will be in ICS very soon...

Three neat Web finds:
  1. Anime and Manga Resourse List The list of all lists having to do with Anime and Manga! Great place to find info on a particular series or info on anything anime and manga related that's available on the web.

  2. The Complete Mobile Police Patlabor Guide Patlabor is currently one of my favorite anime series. Although it has already finished its run on Japanese TV I have been able to see about 20 of the 48 TV episodes (they were subtitled by a fan subtitling group). This page has basically all the data I can ever care to know about on the Patlabor series.

    A Patrol Labor or Patlabor

  3. Sega Web! I spend some of my free time playing video games on my Sega Genesis. This site has info on new releases, news, events and other cool stuff for all of the Sega gaming systems.


Questions I can now answer
  1. How are you able to display graphic files in an HTML document and what type of format must these graphic files be saved in to be displayed properly?
    Jump to Answer

  2. How would you find the current student enrollment breakdown at UCI, in terms of graduates and undergraduates and the fields of study they are involved in?
    Jump to Answer

  3. What is Sega corporation of American currently developing for use in their gaming systems?
    Jump to Answer

  4. What are UCI OAC Friday morning seminars and how are you able to register for them?
    Jump to Answer

  5. What is Microsoft Corporation's Advanced Division currently working on in the field of user interfaces?
    Jump to Answer

  1. Answer to Question #1

     The first part of this assignment requested the class to share three Web finds that we each felt were interesting. My first find lead me to an Anime related FTP site that had thousands of graphic files available for viewing. I starting browsing through the graphic files and found a few that I felt were worthy enough to download. When I decided to display one of these graphics in an HTML document I found out that it was not being properly displayed because I did not save the graphic file in the proper graphic file format required for Mosaic to display it.

    Return to list of questions.

  2. Answer to Question #2

     My familiarity with the Web was very low at the start of the quarter and so I took Professor Franklin's advice and starting to a little browsing. One of my first stops was the UCI Gopher-based Campus Wide Information System. This simple menu has links to a load of stuff, just browsing through this gopher system can take hours. It didn't take long to make realize that the Web's possibilities are quite limitless. Regardless, my initiative brought me to a gopher menu that displays UCI Registar's Office, from here you can select Enrollments to get another menu that has student enrollment information from up to three years past. Each enrollment year is the broken up into a Summary per academic year quarter and enrollment by Majors by Unit. I could not provide a link directly to the menus so you'll have to do a little browsing yourself, just following the directions I provided through the italics and a go to summary to answer the questions I provided earlier.

    Return to list of questions.

  3. Answer to Question #3

     Ahhh...Sega! =) Okay so I'm a video game junky at times and since video game junkies like to know what new games will be coming out for the systems they spend time on I found the Sega Web. I would also like to say that I found out about the Sega Web connection via the rec.games.video.sega Newsgroup on USENET.

    Return to list of questions.

  4. Answer to Question #4

     One day I was taking a good hard look at the UC Irvine Office of Academic Computing home page when the Seminars and Workshops hypertext linked caught my attention. The OAC Friday Morning Seminars are free computer science related seminars that are offered to any UCI affilated person, including students. You can registar to participate though the Seminar Registration via Web form, this form is also made available at the Seminar and Workshop page. The currently announced seminar topics include seminars on the World Wide Web, X-Windows, and the UNIX operating system.

    Return to list of questions.

  5. Answer to Question #5

     I arrived at this question because I needed one more to finish this assignment. What I did was use the EINet Galaxy Homepage to find a topic related to my planned major. Once there I figured Microsoft is one of the richest companies in the world why not see what they are up to so I selected the hypertext link to Microsoft Advanced Technology Division . Which led me to the Microsoft Research User Interfaces Group. Sadly, this page is still under construction and there is not a whole lot there yet.

    Return to list of questions.

Submitted February 16, 1995 for ICS 1C
